questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
An organization is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to assign security roles.
Which tools should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate tools to the correct tasks. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Security configuration toll for all cases

Each one of the tasks is the name of a duty so it should be the same answer for all 3 - which you would do through the sec config form (I wish it wouldn't call these things tools when that's not how they are referred to in the system)

I disagree for processes, you use a Security recording tool task recorder to fish out all roles required for a process. Security permission is just for a specific action like approve invoice.
Process = Multiple security permissions or roles.
Action = Singular security permission
Correct.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are planning a Dynamics 365 implementation.
You need to recommend a solution for the different types of environment instances.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate instance types to the correct scenarios. Each instance type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: 3th one should be Tier 1
Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 1

Tier-2 environment: Standard Acceptance Testing â€“ One Standard Acceptance Testing (UAT) instance is provided for the duration of the subscription. This instance is a non-production multi-box instance that customers can use for UAT, integration testing, and training. Additional sandbox/staging instances can be purchased separately as an optional add-on.

T1
T2
T1

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/imp-lifecycle/environment-planning

Tier 1 for A&C
Tier 2 for B

One Tier 2 sandbox (multi-box environment) for user acceptance testing (UAT).

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/deployment/cloud-deployment-overview
I agree that 3th one should be assigned to Tier 1.
Tier 1, Tier 2 and Tier 1. A typical dev box is a tier 1 and it has Microsoft SQL Server and Visual Studio.
3 is Tier1
Production and UAT use Azure SQL, so the third option should be Tier 1.
The answer is correct as-is.
SQL Server is also used in Tier 1 one box environment, and Azure DB is used in Tier 2 or higher.
Create policy comes first.. Tested in real system

1. Create Policy Rule for Expense keywords
2. Create An Audit Policy for a legal Entity 
3. Select able name, field name and prohibited keywords 

You have to create the rule to use it within the policy, once you select the rule on the policy, then you can select the table and keywords.

This is correct. Audit Policy for Legal entities is dependent on Audit policy rule type. So, create or setup the audit police rule type first, then use it when creating Audit Policy for Legal Entities.

Create and audit policy for a legal entity.
Create a new policy rule for Prohibited keywords rule type
Select table name, field name and Prohibited keywords.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Company policy restricts employees from filling expense reports for the reimbursement of alcoholic beverages.
You need to recommend a solution that checks all expense reports for this requirement.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct
Correct

choices.C: Process data package in the Asset library
choices.D: Software deployable package in the Asset library.

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.
A series of related data packages must be migrated.
You need to define the sequence of the data packages migration.
Which Lifecycle Services tool should you use?

discussion.content: I guess Consolidate on the single master customer number- needs to be done in the Existing ERP systems
Existing ERP, Azure Data Lake, DMF
Existing ERP, Azure Data Lake, DMF, sure

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. The company has 11 legal entities. Each entity uses a separate enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. A customer may have a unique customer number in each system because the systems are disconnected. One of the customer numbers will be used as the master number in Dynamics 365.
The company plans to add entities to Supply Chain Management over time. Customer records will continue to be added to the ERP systems throughout the implementation lifecycle and must be kept up to date. The ERP systems will be decommissioned after go-live.
You need to create a strategy to migrate the customer data and ensure that new records are automatically mapped.
Which solution should you implement for each requirement? To answer, drag the appropriate solutions to the correct requirements. Each solution may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
